stimulusHtml: A sealed horizontal insulated cylinder with cross-sectional area A is divided into two chambers with equal volume V0 by a piston with mass m. The left chamber is filled with a gas at pressure PL and the right chamber is filled with a gas at pressure PR. The piston moves with negligible friction and is initially at rest. The piston is pushed to the left, reducing the volume on the left to V0/2, and then released from rest. Which of the following claims about the motion of the piston as it returns to its original position is correct? Assume the positive direction is to the right.
choicesHtml: The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and negative acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and zero acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and positive acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with negative velocity and negative acceleration.
